text:
Hillary Clinton sat down with Stephen Colbert on The Late Show a couple times during the 2016 presidential election. A few things have happened since then.



She'll return on Tuesday, Sept. 19 for her first late-night television appearance since her bid for the White House. The two will discuss her campaign—and what's going on with the current administration.



Clinton's new book, What Happened, is published by Simon & Schuster, a division of CBS.



The former Secretary of State first visited The Late Show on Tuesday, Oct. 27, 2015 for an interview in the Ed Sullivan Theater. She also hung out with Stephen at Carnegie Deli for an interview that aired the night before the New York Democratic primary in April 2016.



The same night Clinton will be on the program, Academy Award-winning actress Emma Stone will also join Colbert in her first appearance on The Late Show.



Watch all-new episodes of The Late Show with Stephen Colbert weeknights at 11:35/10:35c on CBS and CBS All Access.
title: Stephen Colbert Welcomes Hillary Clinton Back To The Late Show On Tuesday, Sept. 19

og.title: Stephen Colbert Welcomes Hillary Clinton Back To The Late Show On Tuesday, Sept. 19 - CBS.com
og.description: The former Secretary of State makes her first late-night television appearance since the election.
